wrong perl code generated by wml-1.6.7

  • From: Torsten Naumann <nospam@thanx>
  • Date: Thu, 6 Aug 1998 18:57:15 +0200 (MEST)
Hi,

I tried out the new wml version 1.6.7. I have problems with this.
Please try this wml example:
-----------------------------------------------------------------
#use wml::std::logo
<logo name="wml">
-----------------------------------------------------------------




The output I get:
-----------------------------------------------------------------
ePerl:Error: Perl parsing error (interpreter rc=2)

---- Contents of STDERR channel: ---------
syntax error at /tmp/wml.19174.tmp1 line 75, near "my"
Execution of /tmp/wml.19174.tmp1 aborted due to compilation errors.
------------------------------------------
** WML:Break: Error in Pass 3 (rc=74).
-----------------------------------------------------------------



I run this with verbose mode 9 and I see, that in pass 2 wrong perl
code is generated:
-----------------------------------------------------------------
...
<: 
    my $name   = "wml";
    my $base   = "";
    my $file   = "";
    my $target = ""

    my $giffile  = "$WML_LOC_LIBDIR/aux/logos/logo-$name.gif";
    my $infofile = "$WML_LOC_LIBDIR/aux/logos/logo-$name.info";
...
----------------------------------------------------------------

Perl misses the ";" after the my $target = "" . 

--
mit froehlichen Gruessen
Torsten
